alert.note: Alert for Durham (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 06 at 6:11PM EDT until May 06 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM EDT FOR EASTERN PERSON...NORTHWESTERN VANCE...GRANVILLE AND NORTHWESTERN DURHAM COUNTIES... At 611 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Virgilina to 6 miles northwest of Oxford to 6 miles northeast of Butner, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Oxford, Rougemont, Stem, Stovall, Lake Michie, Bahama, Dabney, Lake Butner, Tungsten and Moriah. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for central North Carolina. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
